In *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*, the **apostrophe** (**'**) serves the following purposes:

- ' represents a [golem](/wiki/Golem "Golem"):

  - ' [straw golem](/wiki/Straw_golem "Straw golem")
  - ' [paper golem](/wiki/Paper_golem "Paper golem")
  - ' [rope golem](/wiki/Rope_golem "Rope golem")
  - ' [gold golem](/wiki/Gold_golem "Gold golem")
  - ' [leather golem](/wiki/Leather_golem "Leather golem")
  - ' [wood golem](/wiki/Wood_golem "Wood golem")
  - ' [flesh golem](/wiki/Flesh_golem "Flesh golem")
  - ' [clay golem](/wiki/Clay_golem "Clay golem")
  - ' [stone golem](/wiki/Stone_golem "Stone golem")
  - ' [glass golem](/wiki/Glass_golem "Glass golem")
  - ' [iron golem](/wiki/Iron_golem "Iron golem")

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Historical uses](#Historical_uses)

- [2 Variants](#Variants)

  - [2.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [2.2 UnNetHack](#UnNetHack)
  - [2.3 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [2.4 FIQHack](#FIQHack)
  - [2.5 SpliceHack](#SpliceHack)
  - [2.6 notdNetHack](#notdNetHack)
  - [2.7 EvilHack](#EvilHack)
  - [2.8 GnollHack](#GnollHack)
  - [2.9 SlashTHEM](#SlashTHEM)
  - [2.10 Hack'EM](#Hack.27EM)

## Historical uses

In Hack 1.21, which is based on of [Jay Fenlason's Hack](/wiki/Jay_Fenlason%27s_Hack "Jay Fenlason's Hack"), the [ghost](/wiki/Ghost "Ghost") uses the ' glyph; in Hack for PDP-11, the glyph is given to the [lurker above](/wiki/Lurker_above "Lurker above"). [Hack 1.0](/wiki/Hack_1.0 "Hack 1.0") moves the lurker above to the [tilde](/wiki/Tilde "Tilde") glyph, \~, and [Hack 1.0.1](/wiki/Hack_1.0.1 "Hack 1.0.1") moves it back to ', where it remains from this version to [NetHack 2.3e](/wiki/NetHack_2.3e "NetHack 2.3e").

In [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0"), the golems are introduced and given the ' glyph, and the lurker above is moved to the t glyph with the [trapper](/wiki/Trapper "Trapper").

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

[SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM") introduces several new monsters that use the ' glyph:

- ' [wax golem](/wiki/Wax_golem "Wax golem")
- ' [plastic golem](/wiki/Plastic_golem "Plastic golem")
- ' [Frankenstein's Monster](/wiki/Frankenstein%27s_Monster "Frankenstein's Monster")
- ' [ruby golem](/wiki/Ruby_golem "Ruby golem")
- ' [diamond golem](/wiki/Diamond_golem "Diamond golem")
- ' [sapphire golem](/wiki/Sapphire_golem "Sapphire golem")
- ' [steel golem](/wiki/Steel_golem "Steel golem")
- ' [crystal golem](/wiki/Crystal_golem "Crystal golem")

### UnNetHack

[UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack") introduces a few new monsters that use the ' glyph:

- ' [wax golem](/wiki/Wax_golem "Wax golem")
- ' [ice golem](/wiki/Ice_golem "Ice golem")
- ' [crystal ice golem](/wiki/Crystal_ice_golem "Crystal ice golem")

### dNetHack

[dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") adds several new monsters that use the ' glyph:

- ' [dancing blade](/wiki/Dancing_blade "Dancing blade")
- ' [brain golem](/index.php?title=Brain_golem\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Brain golem (page does not exist)")
- ' [living lectern](/wiki/Living_lectern "Living lectern")
- ' [spell golem](/wiki/Spell_golem "Spell golem")
- ' [semblance](/index.php?title=Semblance\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Semblance (page does not exist)")
- ' [treasury golem](/wiki/Treasury_golem "Treasury golem")
- ' [grove guardian](/index.php?title=Grove_guardian\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Grove guardian (page does not exist)")
- ' [argentum golem](/wiki/Argentum_golem "Argentum golem")
- ' [green-steel golem](/index.php?title=Green-steel_golem\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Green-steel golem (page does not exist)")
- ' [retriever](/wiki/Retriever "Retriever")
- ' [living doll](/wiki/Living_doll "Living doll")
- ' [parasitized doll](/index.php?title=Parasitized_doll\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Parasitized doll (page does not exist)")
- ' [sentinel of Mithardir](/index.php?title=Sentinel_of_Mithardir\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Sentinel of Mithardir (page does not exist)")
- ' [ford guardian](/index.php?title=Ford_guardian\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Ford guardian (page does not exist)")
- ' [chain golem](/index.php?title=Chain_golem\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Chain golem (page does not exist)")
- ' [Arsenal](/wiki/Arsenal "Arsenal")
- ' [zhi ren monk](/index.php?title=Zhi_ren_monk\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Zhi ren monk (page does not exist)")

### FIQHack

[FIQHack](/wiki/FIQHack "FIQHack") changes the glyphs of some of the golems retained from *NetHack*:

| Monster     | Vanilla glyph | FIQHack glyph |
| ----------- | ------------- | ------------- |
| straw golem | '             | '             |
| rope golem  | '             | '             |
| wood golem  | '             | *'*           |
| clay golem  | '             | *'*           |
| glass golem | '             | '             |

### SpliceHack

[SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack") adds several new monsters that use the ' glyph:

- ' [wax golem](/wiki/Wax_golem "Wax golem")
- ' [silver golem](/index.php?title=Silver_golem\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Silver golem (page does not exist)")
- ' [ruby golem](/wiki/Ruby_golem "Ruby golem")
- ' [sapphire golem](/wiki/Sapphire_golem "Sapphire golem")
- ' [steel golem](/wiki/Steel_golem "Steel golem")
- ' [crystal golem](/wiki/Crystal_golem "Crystal golem")

### notdNetHack

[notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack") and [notnotdNetHack](/wiki/NotnotdNetHack "NotnotdNetHack") retain the monsters added in dNetHack and add one new monster that uses the ' glyph:

- ' [Marionette](/index.php?title=Marionette\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Marionette (page does not exist)")

### EvilHack

[EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack") adds one new monster that uses the ' glyph:

- ' [snow golem](/wiki/Snow_golem "Snow golem")

### GnollHack

[GnollHack](/wiki/GnollHack "GnollHack") adds a few new monsters that use the ' glyph:

- ' [bone golem](/index.php?title=Bone_golem\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Bone golem (page does not exist)")
- ' [gemstone golem](/index.php?title=Gemstone_golem\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Gemstone golem (page does not exist)")
- ' [silver golem](/index.php?title=Silver_golem\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Silver golem (page does not exist)")

### SlashTHEM

[SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM") retains the monsters added in SLASH'EM and adds some other monsters that use the ' glyph:

- ' [mist golem](/index.php?title=Mist_golem\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Mist golem (page does not exist)")

- ' [Lightningrod](/index.php?title=Lightningrod\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Lightningrod (page does not exist)")

- [Deferred monsters](/wiki/Deferred_and_defunct_features_\(SlashTHEM\) "Deferred and defunct features (SlashTHEM)"):

  - ' [ice golem](/wiki/Ice_golem "Ice golem")
  - ' [crystal ice golem](/wiki/Crystal_ice_golem "Crystal ice golem")

### Hack'EM

[Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM") adds several new monsters that use the ' glyph, including many from other variants:

- ' [droid](/index.php?title=Droid\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Droid (page does not exist)")
- ' [wax golem](/wiki/Wax_golem "Wax golem")
- ' [plastic golem](/wiki/Plastic_golem "Plastic golem")
- ' [snow golem](/wiki/Snow_golem "Snow golem")
- ' [ruby golem](/wiki/Ruby_golem "Ruby golem")
- ' [diamond golem](/wiki/Diamond_golem "Diamond golem")
- ' [sapphire golem](/wiki/Sapphire_golem "Sapphire golem")
- ' [steel golem](/wiki/Steel_golem "Steel golem")
- ' [crystal golem](/wiki/Crystal_golem "Crystal golem")

'

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
Printable ASCII characters
~ ! @ # $ % ^ & * ( ) _ + space
` 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 8 9 0 - = { } |
Qq Ww Ee Rr Tt Yy Uu Ii Oo Pp : " [ ] \
Aa Ss Dd Ff Gg Hh Jj Kk Ll ? ; ' Ctrl
Zz Xx Cc Vv Bb Nn Mm , . / < > Alt

In NetHack, the apostrophe (') serves the following purposes:

  • ' represents a golem:
    • ' straw golem
    • ' paper golem
    • ' rope golem
    • ' gold golem
    • ' leather golem
    • ' wood golem
    • ' flesh golem
    • ' clay golem
    • ' stone golem
    • ' glass golem
    • ' iron golem

Contents

  • 1 Historical uses
  • 2 Variants
    • 2.1 SLASH'EM
    • 2.2 UnNetHack
    • 2.3 dNetHack
    • 2.4 FIQHack
    • 2.5 SpliceHack
    • 2.6 notdNetHack
    • 2.7 EvilHack
    • 2.8 GnollHack
    • 2.9 SlashTHEM
    • 2.10 Hack'EM

Historical uses

In Hack 1.21, which is based on of Jay Fenlason's Hack, the ghost uses the ' glyph; in Hack for PDP-11, the glyph is given to the lurker above. Hack 1.0 moves the lurker above to the tilde glyph, ~, and Hack 1.0.1 moves it back to ', where it remains from this version to NetHack 2.3e.

In NetHack 3.0.0, the golems are introduced and given the ' glyph, and the lurker above is moved to the t glyph with the trapper.

Variants

SLASH'EM

SLASH'EM introduces several new monsters that use the ' glyph:

  • ' wax golem
  • ' plastic golem
  • ' Frankenstein's Monster
  • ' ruby golem
  • ' diamond golem
  • ' sapphire golem
  • ' steel golem
  • ' crystal golem

UnNetHack

UnNetHack introduces a few new monsters that use the ' glyph:

  • ' wax golem
  • ' ice golem
  • ' crystal ice golem

dNetHack

dNetHack adds several new monsters that use the ' glyph:

  • ' dancing blade
  • ' brain golem
  • ' living lectern
  • ' spell golem
  • ' semblance
  • ' treasury golem
  • ' grove guardian
  • ' argentum golem
  • ' green-steel golem
  • ' retriever
  • ' living doll
  • ' parasitized doll
  • ' sentinel of Mithardir
  • ' ford guardian
  • ' chain golem
  • ' Arsenal
  • ' zhi ren monk

FIQHack

FIQHack changes the glyphs of some of the golems retained from NetHack:

Monster Vanilla glyph FIQHack glyph
straw golem ' '
rope golem ' '
wood golem ' '
clay golem ' '
glass golem ' '

SpliceHack

SpliceHack adds several new monsters that use the ' glyph:

  • ' wax golem
  • ' silver golem
  • ' ruby golem
  • ' sapphire golem
  • ' steel golem
  • ' crystal golem

notdNetHack

notdNetHack and notnotdNetHack retain the monsters added in dNetHack and add one new monster that uses the ' glyph:

  • ' Marionette

EvilHack

EvilHack adds one new monster that uses the ' glyph:

  • ' snow golem

GnollHack

GnollHack adds a few new monsters that use the ' glyph:

  • ' bone golem
  • ' gemstone golem
  • ' silver golem

SlashTHEM

SlashTHEM retains the monsters added in SLASH'EM and adds some other monsters that use the ' glyph:

  • ' mist golem
  • ' Lightningrod
  • Deferred monsters:
    • ' ice golem
    • ' crystal ice golem

Hack'EM

Hack'EM adds several new monsters that use the ' glyph, including many from other variants:

  • ' droid
  • ' wax golem
  • ' plastic golem
  • ' snow golem
  • ' ruby golem
  • ' diamond golem
  • ' sapphire golem
  • ' steel golem
  • ' crystal golem
